subject: Tennis
Ethics
lead_paragraph: Two former British police officers who fought corruption in horse racing and cricket are going to head tennis’s efforts to prevent matches from being fixed. Ben Gunn, who has worked for the British Horseracing Authority, and Jeff Rees, who retired in November from the International Cricket Council’s security unit, were appointed Monday by tennis’s governing bodies.
